00022 /**
00023  * @file   SketchQuantNormTran.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Fri Oct 21 18:16:03 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing normalization. Can do sketch and full quantile (just
00028  * set sketch to chip size) and supports bioconductor compatibility.
00029  */
00030 
00031 //
00032 #include "chipstream/SketchQuantNormTran.h"

00045 /** 
00046  * Constructor.
00047  *
00048  * @param sketchSize - Number of data points to use for
00049  * approximating full quantile normalization.
00050  * @param biocCompat - Should ties in rank be done in same manner as
00051  * bioconductor affy package?
00052  * @param lowPrecision - Should we truncate values as if we had been written to cel file?
00053  * @param usePmSubset - Should we use just the perfect match probes for normalization?
00054  */
00055 SketchQuantNormTran::SketchQuantNormTran(int sketchSize, bool biocCompat, 
00056                                          bool lowPrecision, bool usePmSubset,
00057                                          float target, bool doavg) :    
00058   m_SketchSize(sketchSize), m_BiocCompat(biocCompat), 
00059   m_LowPrecision(lowPrecision), m_UsePmSubset(usePmSubset),
00060   m_Target(target), m_DoAverage(doavg) {
00061   setUpSelfDoc(*this);
00062   m_Type = getDocName();
00063   if(sketchSize > 0)
00064     m_ExtractSketch = new ExtractSketch<std::vector<float>::iterator >(m_SketchSize);
00065   else 
00066     m_ExtractSketch = NULL;
00067   setOptValue("sketch", ToStr(m_SketchSize));
00068   setOptValue("bioc", m_BiocCompat);
00069   setOptValue("lowprecision", m_LowPrecision);
00070   setOptValue("usepm", m_UsePmSubset);
00071   setOptValue("target", ToStr(m_Target));
00072   setOptValue("doavg", m_DoAverage);
00073   m_UsePrecompSketch = false;
00074   /// @todo Shouldnt there be a for loop here? Otherwise this is constant. -jhg
00075   md5sum md5;
00076   md5.final(m_ProbeMd5sum);
00077   setOptValue("subsetmd5", m_ProbeMd5sum);
00078   //
00079   m_a5_filename="";
00080   m_a5_shared_group=NULL;
00081   m_SubProbeCount = 0;
00082 }
00083

00085 /**
00086  * Destructor. 
00087  */
00088 SketchQuantNormTran::~SketchQuantNormTran() {
00089   delete m_ExtractSketch;
00090   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ToFree.size(); i++) {
00091     delete m_ToFree[i];
00092   }
00093 }

00095 /** 
00096  * @brief Only use a subset of all probes for normalization. For
00097  * example RMA only uses PM probes or might want to just use control
00098  * genes.
00099  * @param subsetProbes - bitmask indicating which probes to use for
00100  * normalization.
00101  */
00102 void SketchQuantNormTran::setSubProbes(const vector<bool> &subsetProbes) {
00103   unsigned int i = 0;
00104   md5sum md5;
00105   m_SubProbes = subsetProbes;
00106   m_SubProbeCount = 0;
00107   for(i = 0; i < m_SubProbes.size(); i++) {
00108     if(m_SubProbes[i] == true) {
00109       m_SubProbeCount++;
00110       // "nbo" put data in network byte order (big endian) for the checksum
00111       // note that only the index (i) is used, not the actual probesids.
00112       md5.update_nbo(i);
00113     }
00114   }
00115   md5.final(m_ProbeMd5sum);
00116   setOptValue("subsetmd5", m_ProbeMd5sum);
00117   if(m_SketchSize > m_SubProbeCount) 
00118     m_SketchSize = m_SubProbeCount;
00119 } 
00120 
00121 void SketchQuantNormTran::transformDataSuppliedSketch(std::vector<float> &data) {
00122   transformDataSuppliedSketch(m_Sketches.size() - 1, data);
00123 }
00124 
00125 void SketchQuantNormTran::transformDataSuppliedSketch(int index, std::vector<float> &data) {
00126   if(m_SketchSize != m_AverageSketch.size()) {
00127     Err::errAbort("SketchQuantNormTran::newChipSuppliedTargetSketch() - Precomputed target sketch (N=" +
00128                   ToStr(m_AverageSketch.size()) + ") must equal extracted sketch size (N=" +
00129                   ToStr(m_SketchSize) + ")," +
00130                   " cel file: " + m_TransformedIMart->getCelFileNames()[index]);
00131   }
00132   // @todo - Do we need to keep this around?
00133   // /* If we're trying to be compatible with exact we have to pretend that we 
00134   //  * read our sketch from a truncated cel file. */
00135   // if(m_LowPrecision) {
00136   //   std::vector<float>::iterator sketch= m_Sketches[index];
00137   //   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_SketchSize; i++) {
00138   //     *(sketch + i) = Convert::floatLowPrecision( *(sketch + i) );
00139   //   }
00140   // }
00141   
00142   /* Transform the data to pass it on to the next chipstream. */
00143   Verbose::out(2, "Passing data on as we are using preset sketch.");
00144   for(uint32_t i = 0; i < data.size(); i++) {
00145     data[i] = transform(i, index, data[i]);
00146   }
00147 }
00148 
00149 /** 
00150  * When we have a precomputed distribution to normalize against
00151  * we can handle things differently, like passing data through rather
00152  * than caching it for computing target sketch.
00153  * @param data - vector of new chip data from same sample.
00154  */
00155 void SketchQuantNormTran::newChipSuppliedTargetSketch(std::vector<float> &data) {
00156   unsigned int index = 0;
00157   //  unsigned int interpIx = 0;
00158 
00159 
00160     /* Pull out the probes used to do the normalization. */
00161     extractSketch(data);
00162     /* Sanity check for sizes.*/
00163     if(m_SketchSize != m_AverageSketch.size()) {
00164       Err::errAbort("SketchQuantNormTran::newChipSuppliedTargetSketch() - Precomputed target sketch (N=" +
00165                     ToStr(m_AverageSketch.size()) + ") must equal extracted sketch size (N=" +
00166                     ToStr(m_SketchSize) + ").");
00167     }
00168     index = m_Sketches.size() - 1;
00169     /* If we're trying to be compatible with exact we have to pretend that we 
00170      * read our sketch from a truncated cel file. */
00171     if(m_LowPrecision) {
00172       std::vector<float>::iterator sketch= m_Sketches[index];
00173       for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_SketchSize; i++) {
00174         *(sketch + i) = Convert::floatLowPrecision( *(sketch + i) );
00175       }
00176     }
00177 
00178     if (index == 0)
00179       scaleTargetSketch();
00180 
00181     /* Transform the data to pass it on to the next chipstream. */
00182     Verbose::out(2, "Passing data on as we are using preset sketch.");
00183     for(uint32_t i = 0; i < data.size(); i++) {
00184       /* *sigh* again, if we're trying to be compatible with exact we
00185        * have to pretend that we read our sketch from a truncated cel
00186        * file. Sometimes backward compatibility isn't pretty... */
00187       if(m_LowPrecision) {
00188         data[i] = Convert::floatLowPrecision(interpolate_qnorm(data[i], 
00189                         m_Sketches[index], m_Sketches[index]+m_SketchSize, 
00190                         m_AverageSketch.begin(), m_AverageSketch.end(), 
00191                         m_PartialSums.begin(), m_PartialSums.end(), 
00192                         m_BiocCompat));
00193         if (!Util::isFinite(data[i])) {
00194             data[i] = Convert::floatLowPrecision(m_AverageSketch[m_AverageSketch.size() - 1]);
00195         }
00196       }
00197       else {
00198         data[i] = interpolate_qnorm(data[i], 
00199                         m_Sketches[index], m_Sketches[index]+m_SketchSize, 
00200                         m_AverageSketch.begin(), m_AverageSketch.end(), 
00201                         m_PartialSums.begin(), m_PartialSums.end(), 
00202                         m_BiocCompat);
00203         if (!Util::isFinite(data[i])) {
00204           data[i] = m_AverageSketch[m_AverageSketch.size() - 1];
00205         }
00206       }
00207     }
00208 }
00209 
00210 
00211 
00212 void SketchQuantNormTran::extractSketch(std::vector<float> &data) {
00213   vector<float> copy;
00214   unsigned int i = 0, currentPm = 0;
00215 
00216   if(m_ExtractSketch == NULL) {
00217     m_ExtractSketch = new ExtractSketch<vector<float>::iterator >(m_SketchSize);
00218   }
00219   /* Sanity checks. */
00220   if(m_UsePmSubset && m_SubProbes.empty())
00221     Err::errAbort("Must specify PM subset when using PM probes for normalization.");
00222   if(m_SubProbes.size() > 0 && data.size() != m_SubProbes.size()) 
00223     Err::errAbort("SketchQuantNormTran::newChip() - Chip Data different size than Pm Probe Vector");
00224 
00225   // Add a new sketch.
00226   std::vector<float> *pVec = new vector<float>(m_SketchSize);
00227   m_ToFree.push_back(pVec);
00228   m_Sketches.push_back(pVec->begin());
00229    /* If we're doing a subset of the data, put subset into copy and
00230      normalize from copy. */
00231   if(m_SubProbes.size() > 0) {
00232     copy.resize(m_SubProbeCount);
00233     /* First filter out PM probes, for RMA only use pm probes. */
00234     for(i = 0; i < m_SubProbes.size(); i++) {
00235       if(m_SubProbes[i] == true) {
00236         copy[currentPm] = data[i];
00237         currentPm++;
00238       }
00239     }
00240     // Fill in the sketch from the copy
00241     (*m_ExtractSketch)(copy.begin(), copy.end(), pVec->begin());
00242   }
00243   else {
00244     // Fill in the sketch from the data.
00245     (*m_ExtractSketch)(data.begin(), data.end(), pVec->begin());
00246   }
00247 }
00248   
00249 /** 
00250  * @brief transform the intensity point supplied coming from a particular
00251  * probe in a particular microarray.
00252  * 
00253  * @param probeIx - Probe index from the cel file.
00254  * @param chipIx - Set of chips from same sample.
00255  * @param intensity - Original intensities.
00256  * @param return - transformed intensities.
00257  */
00258 void SketchQuantNormTran::transform(int chipIx, std::vector<float>& intensity) {
00259   if (m_UsePrecompSketch) {
00260     transformDataSuppliedSketch(chipIx, intensity);
00261   }
00262   else {
00263     /* all the hard work is done just for us by the iterpolater
00264        function object for this chip. */
00265     for (int probeIx = 0; probeIx < intensity.size(); probeIx++) {
00266       intensity[probeIx] = transform(probeIx, chipIx, intensity[probeIx]);
00267     }
00268   }
00269 }
00270 
00271 float SketchQuantNormTran::transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity) {
00272   /* all the hard work is done just for us by the iterpolater
00273      function object for this chip. */
00274     
00275   intensity = interpolate_qnorm(intensity, 
00276                           m_Sketches[chipIx], m_Sketches[chipIx]+m_SketchSize, 
00277                           m_AverageSketch.begin(), m_AverageSketch.end(), 
00278                           m_PartialSums.begin(), m_PartialSums.end(), 
00279                           m_BiocCompat, 0.0f, true);
00280   if(m_LowPrecision) { intensity = Convert::floatLowPrecision(intensity); }
00281   if(intensity < 0) {
00282     Err::errAbort("Negative values found when trying to normalize. chip: " + ToStr(chipIx) +
00283                   " probe: " + ToStr(probeIx + 1) +
00284                   " cel file: " + m_TransformedIMart->getCelFileNames()[chipIx]);
00285   }
00286       if (!Util::isFinite(intensity)) {
00287     intensity = m_AverageSketch[m_AverageSketch.size() - 1];
00288   }
00289   return intensity;
00290 }
00291 
00292 void SketchQuantNormTran::newChip(std::vector<float> &data) {
00293   extractSketch(data);
00294 }
00295 
00296 void SketchQuantNormTran::finishedChips() {
00297   if (!m_UsePrecompSketch) {
00298     computeTargetSketch();
00299   }
00300 }
00301 
00302 /** 
00303  * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data.
00304  * @param data - Vector of vectors of cel file data.
00305  */
00306 void SketchQuantNormTran::newDataSet(IntensityMart* iMart) {
00307   
00308   if (m_SketchSize < 100)
00309     Verbose::out(1, "Warning: Are you sure you want sketchsize < 100?");
00310 
00311   int cel_dataset_count = iMart->getCelDataSetCount();
00312   m_TransformedIMart = iMart;
00313   // if there aren't any chipstream nodes after this, then don't store
00314   // all of the intensities
00315   if (m_Streams.empty()) {
00316     m_TransformedIMart->setStoreAllCelIntensities(false);
00317   }
00318 
00319   std::vector<float> data;
00320   ///@todo Handle multiple sketches for multiple channels
00321   Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Computing sketch normalization for " + ToStr(cel_dataset_count) + " cel datasets", cel_dataset_count, 0, cel_dataset_count);
00322   for (int d = 0; d < cel_dataset_count; d++) {
00323     Verbose::progressStep(1);
00324     data = iMart->getCelData(d);
00325     newChip(data);
00326     if(m_UsePrecompSketch) {
00327       transformDataSuppliedSketch(data);
00328       m_TransformedIMart->setProbeIntensity(d, data);
00329     }
00330   }
00331   Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00332   if (!m_UsePrecompSketch) {
00333     computeTargetSketch();
00334   }
00335   if (!m_UsePrecompSketch) {
00336     Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Applying sketch normalization to " + ToStr(cel_dataset_count) + " cel datasets", cel_dataset_count, 0, cel_dataset_count);
00337     for (int d = 0; d < cel_dataset_count; d++) {
00338       Verbose::progressStep(1);
00339       data = iMart->getCelData(d);
00340       transform(d, data);
00341       m_TransformedIMart->setProbeIntensity(d, data);
00342     }
00343     Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00344   }
00345 
00346   chipStreamPassNewChip(m_TransformedIMart);
00347 }

00350 /** 
00351  * Save the current m_AverageSketch to a file.
00352  * @param fileName - where to write the sketch.
00353  */  
00354 void SketchQuantNormTran::saveTargetSketchToFile(const std::string& fileName) {
00355   // printf("### saveTargetSketchToFile('%s')",fileName.c_str());
00356   //
00357   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00358   tsv.addHeader("tsv-file-type","quantile-norm-sketch");
00359   tsv.defineFile("intensities");
00360   tsv.setPrecision(0,0,8);
00361   tsv.writeTsv_v1(fileName);
00362   //
00363   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_AverageSketch.size(); i++) {
00364     tsv.set(0,0,m_AverageSketch[i]);
00365     tsv.writeLevel(0);
00366   }
00367   tsv.close();
00368 }
00369 
00370 void SketchQuantNormTran::saveTargetSketchToFile_a5(const std::string& fileName) {
00371   try {
00372     affx::File5_File* file5=new affx::File5_File();
00373     file5->open(fileName,affx::FILE5_REPLACE);
00374     
00375     saveTargetSketchToGroup_a5(file5);
00376     
00377     file5->close();
00378     delete file5;
00379   }
00380   catch(...) {
00381     Err::errAbort("Cannot open file: " + fileName);
00382   }
00383 }
00384 
00385 void SketchQuantNormTran::saveTargetSketchToGroup_a5(affx::File5_Group* group5) {
00386   //
00387   affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5=group5->openTsv("target-sketch",affx::FILE5_CREATE);
00388   tsv5->defineColumn(0,0,"intensities",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE,0);
00389   // 
00390   for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_AverageSketch.size(); i++) {
00391     tsv5->set_d(0,0,m_AverageSketch[i]);
00392     tsv5->writeLevel(0);
00393   }
00394   //
00395   tsv5->close();
00396   delete tsv5;
00397 }
00398 
00399 /** 
00400  * @brief Signal that no more data is coming (i.e. newChip() will not be
00401  * called anymore. Currently the class builds up all the sketches and then
00402  * does the normalization when this function is called. This makes it
00403  * difficult to pass through data to downstream. If a precomputed sketch
00404  * is supplied then the data can be passed through chip by chip.
00405  */
00406 void SketchQuantNormTran::endDataSet() {
00407   /* Flush data in stream. */
00408   chipStreamEndChips();
00409 
00410   if(m_FileOutName != "") {
00411     saveTargetSketchToFile(m_FileOutName);
00412   }
00413   if(m_a5_filename!="") {
00414     saveTargetSketchToFile_a5(m_a5_filename);
00415   }
00416   if (m_a5_shared_group!=NULL) {
00417     saveTargetSketchToGroup_a5(m_a5_shared_group);
00418   }
00419 
00420   if (m_TransformedIMart != NULL) {
00421     // intensities have been transformed, so we don't need the
00422     // sketches anymore
00423     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_ToFree.size(); i++) {
00424       delete m_ToFree[i];
00425     }
00426     m_ToFree.clear();
00427     m_Sketches.clear();
00428   }
00429 }
00430 
00431 /**
00432  * @brief Scale the target sketch
00433  */
00434 void SketchQuantNormTran::scaleTargetSketch() {
00435   if(m_Target > 0.0) {
00436     // Compute scaling factor
00437     double scalingFactor = 1.0; // default to no scaling, reset below
00438     if(m_DoAverage) {
00439         double mean = average(m_AverageSketch.begin(), m_AverageSketch.end());
00440         scalingFactor = m_Target / mean;
00441         Verbose::out(2,"Mean for quant-norm sketch is " + ToStr(mean));
00442     } else {
00443         double med = median(m_AverageSketch.begin(), m_AverageSketch.end());
00444         scalingFactor = m_Target / med;
00445         Verbose::out(2,"Median for quant-norm sketch is " + ToStr(med));
00446     }
00447     Verbose::out(2,"Scaling factor for quant-norm sketch set to " + ToStr(scalingFactor));
00448 
00449     // scale the target sketch
00450     for(int i = 0; i < m_AverageSketch.size(); i++) {
00451         m_AverageSketch[i] *= scalingFactor;
00452     }
00453 
00454     // update the partial sums
00455     updatePartialSums();
00456   }
00457 }
00458     
00459 /** 
00460  * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00461  * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00462  */
00463 void SketchQuantNormTran::setUpSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00464   doc.setDocName(SKETCHQUANTNORMSTR);
00465   doc.setDocDescription("Class for doing quantile normalization. Can do sketch and full quantile (just set sketch to chip size or zero) and supports bioconductor compatibility.");
00466   doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00467 }
00468 
00469 /** 
00470  * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00471  * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00472  */
00473 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> SketchQuantNormTran::getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00474   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00475   SelfDoc::Opt sketch = {"sketch", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "-1", "-1", "-1", "NA", 
00476                          "How many data points from chip to use for normalization (-1 to use default of max of 1% of the chip or 50,000) Use 0 for full quantile normalization."};
00477   opts.push_back(sketch);
00478   SelfDoc::Opt bioc = {"bioc", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA", 
00479                        "Set to 'true' for resolving ties in the same order as bioconductor's affy package."};
00480   opts.push_back(bioc);
00481   SelfDoc::Opt lowprecision = {"lowprecision", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA", 
00482                                "Set to 'true' to truncate values as seen when writing results to a normalized cel file."};
00483   opts.push_back(lowprecision);
00484   SelfDoc::Opt usepm = {"usepm", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00485                         "Set to true if only using pm probes to do normalization (i.e. rma)"};
00486   opts.push_back(usepm);
00487   SelfDoc::Opt target = {"target", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.0", "0.0", "0", "NA", 
00488                          "Target intensity to set all chips median (or average) to."};
00489   opts.push_back(target);
00490   SelfDoc::Opt doavg = {"doavg", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
00491                         "Set to true to do average rather than median."};
00492   opts.push_back(doavg);
00493   SelfDoc::Opt probeMd5 = {"subsetmd5", SelfDoc::Opt::String, "", "", "NA", "NA",
00494                            "Md5sum of the probe ids being used for normalization."};
00495   opts.push_back(probeMd5);
00496   return opts;
00497 }

00499 
00500 /** 
00501  * End reading chips when we have to compute the target
00502  * (m_AverageSketch) ourselves.
00503  */
00504 void SketchQuantNormTran::computeTargetSketch() {
00505   vector<vector <float>::iterator> cellDataItVec;
00506   // Set up function object with coorect types.
00507   AverageSketch< vector< vector<float>::iterator >::iterator, vector<float>::iterator, double> as;
00508   m_AverageSketch.clear();
00509   m_AverageSketch.resize(m_SketchSize);
00510   // This is the hard work here...
00511   as(m_Sketches.begin(), m_Sketches.end(), (*m_Sketches.begin()) + m_SketchSize, m_AverageSketch.begin());
00512  
00513   updatePartialSums();
00514 
00515   scaleTargetSketch();
00516 
00517 //   if(m_Streams.size() > 0) {
00518 //     Err::errAbort("SketchQuantNormTran stream does not currently pass through values unless a target sketch is set.");
00519 //   }
00520 }
00521 
00522 /** 
00523  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00524  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00525  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00526  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00527  * 
00528  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00529  * 
00530  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00531  */
00532 SelfCreate *SketchQuantNormTran::newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
00533   SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00534   int sketchSize = 100000;
00535   bool bioc = false, lowprecision = false, usepm = false, doavg = false;
00536   float target = 0.0;
00537   
00538   fillInValue(sketchSize, "sketch", param, doc);
00539   fillInValue(bioc, "bioc", param, doc);
00540   fillInValue(lowprecision, "lowprecision", param, doc);
00541   fillInValue(usepm, "usepm", param, doc);
00542   fillInValue(target, "target", param, doc);
00543   fillInValue(doavg, "doavg", param, doc);
00544   SketchQuantNormTran *qnorm = new SketchQuantNormTran(sketchSize, bioc, lowprecision, usepm, target, doavg);
00545   return qnorm;
00546 }
00547 
00548 /**
00549  * Open and read a target distribution from a text file. Must have a column
00550  * called 'intensities' with distribution quantiles sorted from highest to
00551  * lowest.
00552  *
00553  * @param fileName - text file containing column of quantiles.
00554  * @param targetSketch - vector to load up with our intensities
00555  */
00556 void SketchQuantNormTran::readTargetSketchFromFile(const std::string& fileName, std::vector<float> &targetSketch) {
00557   TsvFile tsv;
00558   double intensity;
00559   // file ok
00560   if (File5_File::isHdf5file(fileName)==1) {
00561     Err::errAbort("A5 implementation of target-sketch is not yet implemented.");
00562   }
00563   int rc = tsv.open(fileName);
00564   assert(rc==TSV_OK);
00565   //
00566   tsv.bind(0,"intensities",&intensity,affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00567 
00568   targetSketch.clear();
00569   while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00570     targetSketch.push_back(intensity);
00571   }
00572 
00573   tsv.close();
00574 }
00575 
00576 void SketchQuantNormTran::setParameters(PsBoard &board) { 
00577   setProbeCount(board.getProbeInfo()->getProbeCount());
00578   if(getUsePmSubset()) {
00579     std::vector<bool> pm;
00580     board.getProbeInfo()->getProbePm(pm);
00581     setSubProbes(pm);
00582   }
00583   if (!board.getOptions()->getOpt("out-dir").empty()) {
00584     string outFile = board.getOptions()->getOpt("out-dir")  + getType() + ToStr(".normalization-target.txt");
00585     saveTargetSketch(outFile);
00586   }
00587   if (!board.getOptions()->getOpt("a5-sketch").empty()) {
00588     //    Err::errAbort("What is the best way to support the global a5 via blackboard?");
00589   }
00590   if (!board.getOptions()->getOpt("target-sketch").empty()) {
00591     if (board.getOptions()->getOptBool("a5-sketch")) {
00592       Err::errAbort("What is the best way to support the global a5 via blackboard?");
00593     }
00594     vector<float> sketch;
00595     string fileName = board.getOptions()->getOpt("target-sketch");
00596     Verbose::out(1, "Reading sketch from: " + fileName);
00597     readTargetSketchFromFile(fileName, sketch);
00598     setTargetSketch(sketch);
00599   }
00600   
00601 }
